TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MetadataNavigationSettings extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Configures which settings on a object on an object control the display of metadata hierarchies and filters on list views.

remarks.para: Gets settings from and sets settings to an object and persists them such that the list, site hierarchy tree, and filter controls can use them in the list view page UI. Always use the GetMetadataNavigationSettings static method to get settings from an object when initializing new instances of the object.

By default, all lists have settings where no key filters are configured and only the special folder hierarchy type is configured, which shows only the object in the tree. Use these methods to modify metadata hierarchy and key filter data in the tree.

item.term: AddConfiguredHierarchy method to add additional metadata hierarchies and key filters to settings.

item.description: Determines whether configured hierarchies exist in settings.Use the result on the original settings instead of creating a new hierarchy to ensure that the internal view settings are preserved. After adjusting the object originally retrieved from the list, set the adjusted settings back on the list with the MetadataNavigationSettings.SetMetadataNavigationSettings object.
Determines whether configured items exist in the settings.
Empties settings and then adds new hierarchies in the desired order.
Empties settings and then adds key filters in the desired order.
